alert.note: Alert for Southern Seward Peninsula Coast (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued February 22 at 1:33PM AKST until February 23 at 9:00AM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM AKST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations of 10 to 18 inches and ice accumulation of a light glaze. Winds gusting as high as 55 mph. Visibility one quarter mile or less at times. * WHERE...Southern Seward Peninsula Coast. * WHEN...Through 9 AM AKST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Areas of blowing snow reducing visibility to one quarter mile or less at times. Gusty winds could blow items around. A brief period of freezing rain could make surfaces very slippery.
info.instruction: A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds and poor visibilities are likely. This will lead to whiteout conditions, making travel extremely difficult.
